title: cellranger_count
description: Align fastq files using Cell Ranger count.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `sample_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz;sample_S1_L001_R2_001.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The fastq
input.help_text: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `sample_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz;sample_S1_L001_R2_001.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The fastq.gz files to align. Can also be a single directory containing fastq.gz files.

reference.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `reference.tar.gz`. The path to Cell Ranger reference tar
reference.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `reference.tar.gz`. The path to Cell Ranger reference tar.gz file. Can also be a directory.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `/path/to/output`. The folder to store the alignment results
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `/path/to/output`. The folder to store the alignment results.

expect_cells.description: Type: `integer`, example: `3000`. Expected number of recovered cells, used as input to cell calling algorithm
expect_cells.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `3000`. Expected number of recovered cells, used as input to cell calling algorithm.

force_cells.description: Type: `integer`, example: `3000`. Force pipeline to use this number of cells, bypassing cell calling algorithm
force_cells.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `3000`. Force pipeline to use this number of cells, bypassing cell calling algorithm.

chemistry.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `auto`, choices: ``auto`, `threeprime`, `fiveprime`, `SC3Pv1`, `SC3Pv2`, `SC3Pv3`, `SC3Pv4`, `SC3Pv3LT`, `SC3Pv3HT`, `SC5P-PE-v3`, `SC5P-PE`, `SC5P-R2`, `SC-FB`, `ARC-v1``. Assay configuration.
- auto: autodetect mode
- threeprime: Single Cell 3'
- fiveprime: Single Cell 5'
- SC3Pv1: Single Cell 3' v1 
  NOTE: this mode cannot be auto-detected. It must be set explicitly with this option.
- SC3Pv2: Single Cell 3' v2
- SC3Pv3: Single Cell 3' v3
- SC3Pv4: Single Cell 3' v4
- SC3Pv3LT: Single Cell 3' v3 LT
- SC3Pv3HT: Single Cell 3' v3 HT
- SC5P-PE-v3: Single Cell 5' paired-end v3 (GEM-X)
- SC5P-PE: Single Cell 5' paired-end
- SC5P-R2: Single Cell 5' R2-only
- SC-FB: Single Cell Antibody-only 3' v2 or 5'
- ARC-v1: for analyzing the Gene Expression portion of Multiome data. 
  NOTE: when the pipeline auto-detects ARC-v1 chemistry, an error is triggered.
See https://kb.10xgenomics.com/hc/en-us/articles/115003764132-How-does-Cell-Ranger-auto-detect-chemistry- for more information.

secondary_analysis.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. Whether or not to run the secondary analysis e
secondary_analysis.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `false`. Whether or not to run the secondary analysis e.g. clustering.

generate_bam.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to generate a BAM file
generate_bam.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to generate a BAM file.

include_introns.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Include intronic reads in count
include_introns.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Include intronic reads in count.

r1_length.description: Type: `integer`. Hard trim the input Read 1 to this length before analysis
r1_length.help_text: Type: `integer`. Hard trim the input Read 1 to this length before analysis

r2_length.description: Type: `integer`. Hard trim the input Read 2 to this length before analysis
r2_length.help_text: Type: `integer`. Hard trim the input Read 2 to this length before analysis

lanes.description: Type: List of `integer`, example: `1;2;3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Only use FASTQs from selected lanes
lanes.help_text: Type: List of `integer`, example: `1;2;3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Only use FASTQs from selected lanes.

library_compatibility_check.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to check for barcode compatibility between libraries
library_compatibility_check.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether to check for barcode compatibility between libraries.

min_crispr_umi.description: Type: `integer`. Set the minimum number of CRISPR guide RNA UMIs required for protospacer detection
min_crispr_umi.help_text:
Type: `integer`. Set the minimum number of CRISPR guide RNA UMIs required for protospacer detection.
If a lower or higher sensitivity is desired for detection, this value can be customized
according to specific experimental needs. Applicable only to datasets that include a
CRISPR Guide Capture library.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
